column4: Since my laptop doesn't have a mouse wheel button, is there a different way to paste text into terminal?
shift + insert
what do you want it to do?
well you asked for an equivelant, what is it an equivelant to?
please use tab to complete my nick
and you didnt answer my question, WHAT do yu want an equivelant to?
sweet
I'm wondering what the Linux equivalent would be to 'ctrl+alt+del'?
yes you said that. I have NO idea what you want the keypress to do
ok, not a big deal
thats why i ask, what is it an equivelant to?. When you press it what will it do, load gedit?
i dont know what you expect ctrl+alt+del so i am asking so we can proceed
I understand now... mainly, I'm looking for a process killer/task manager
ok great, THTS why I was after
I heard you can you do it in terminal a lot easier but too familiar with the cmd yet
*not too familiar
you can run xkill and click the app to die
i run xkill in terminal?
sure, or if you press alt-f2 you can launch it there
ok, kool
thanks
there are 2 ommands to run which will enable ctrl+alt+del to bring up gnome system monitor: http://www.linuxforums.org/forum/ubuntu-help/74391-ctrl-alt-delete.html
